headline.main: THE FLORENCE NIGHTINGALE OF THE NURSERY.; A PERFECT CHARM. REV. SYLVANUS COBB THUS WRITES IN THE BOSTON CHRISTIAN FREEMAN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is an extract from a letter written by the Rev. C.Z. Weizer, to the German Reformed Messenger, at Chambersburg, Penn.:

docs.snippet: Col. PIPER, of Cambria County, offers a full regiment, from that County, to President LINCOLN, through Gov. CURTIN, to enlist for any period designated by the President.
docs.lead_paragraph: Col. PIPER, of Cambria County, offers a full regiment, from that County, to President LINCOLN, through Gov. CURTIN, to enlist for any period designated by the President.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF AN ARTILLERY COMPANY FROM WILMINGTON, N.C.,

docs.snippet: There is no present interruption of trains over the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad, and the Legislature reassembles to-day. Since the failure of the Committee of Safety bill, the Secessionists, it is said, will not attempt to call a Convention. If they...
docs.lead_paragraph: There is no present interruption of trains over the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad, and the Legislature reassembles to-day. Since the failure of the Committee of Safety bill, the Secessionists, it is said, will not attempt to call a Convention. If they do the Union men will insist that the question of Convention or no Convention shall be submitted to the people at the election for Delegates.

docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamship Cahawba, J. W. SMITH, Commander, from New-Orleans and Havana, arrived at this port at an early hour yesterday morning.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE CAHAWBA.; News from Havana, Venezuela and Mexico.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Cahawba, J. W. SMITH, Commander, from New-Orleans and Havana, arrived at this port at an early hour yesterday morning.

docs.snippet: Gov. MORGAN has received communications from the War Department, expressing obligations for the promptness and dispatch with which the troops were sent from New-York for the defence of the Capital, but requesting that no more may be forwarded to that...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. MORGAN has received communications from the War Department, expressing obligations for the promptness and dispatch with which the troops were sent from New-York for the defence of the Capital, but requesting that no more may be forwarded to that point until further advices are received from the Department, all being deemed now safe at Washington.
